referenceFunction.name: transport, freight, lorry, unspecified {BR}| transport, freight, lorry, all sizes, unregulated to generic market for transport, freight, lorry, unspecified | APOS, U
referenceFunction.localName: transport, freight, lorry, unspecified {BR}| transport, freight, lorry, all sizes, unregulated to generic market for transport, freight, lorry, unspecified | APOS, U

geography.text: The inventory is modelled for Brazil

representativeness.extrapolations: This dataset has been extrapolated from year 2019 to the year of the calculation (2021). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

person.name: Nikolia Stoikou stoikou@ecoinvent.org ., . Zürich, Switzerland is active author: False

exchange.name: transport, freight, lorry, unspecified {BR}| transport, freight, lorry, all sizes, unregulated to generic market for transport, freight, lorry, unspecified | APOS, U
transport, freight, lorry >32 metric ton, unregulated {BR}| market for transport, freight, lorry >32 metric ton, unregulated | APOS, U
exchange.generalComment:
(1,1,2,1,1,na) Calculated from the production volumes.
Production volume retrieved from the Brazilian National Logistic Plan -2025 (EPL, 2018), which reports the amount of 1,548 billion tonne.km of freight transported by lorries in 2015. The split among lorry size categories has been calculated according to fleet sizes, annual mileages and freight loads. The average annual mileage accounts for the annual mileage decay according to the fleet age of each size class (CETESB, 2019). Furthermore, the shares of emission regulation classes are estimated according to their respective fleet size reported for the state of São Paulo in 2018 (CETESB, 2019).
References:
CETESB (2019). Companhia Ambiental do Estado de São Paulo (2019). Emissões Veiculares no Estado de São Paulo. Governo do Estado de São Paulo. Available at: cetesb.sp.gov.br/veicular/relatoriose-publicacoes/. [Accessed on 15/06/2020]
EPL (2018). Plano Nacional de Logística. PNL - 2025. Relatório Executivo. Available at: epl.gov.br/transporte-inter-regional-de-carga-no-brasil-panorama-2015 [Accessed on 24/05/2021]

exchange.name: transport, freight, lorry 16-32 metric ton, unregulated {BR}| market for transport, freight, lorry 16-32 metric ton, unregulated | APOS, U
exchange.generalComment:
(1,1,2,1,1,na) Calculated from the production volumes.
Production volume retrieved from the Brazilian National Logistic Plan -2025 (EPL, 2018), which reports the amount of 1,548 billion tonne.km of freight transported by lorries in 2015. The split among lorry size categories has been calculated according to fleet sizes, annual mileages and freight loads. The average annual mileage accounts for the annual mileage decay according to the fleet age of each size class (CETESB, 2019). Furthermore, the shares of emission regulation classes are estimated according to their respective fleet size reported for the state of São Paulo in 2018 (CETESB, 2019). It is estimated, that 10% of this transport is used for transport of goods in need of atmosphere control. And thus this production volume is included in the ""transport, freight, lorry ... with refrigeration machine"" datasets. It is also estimated, that 50% of the production volume of this transport is transfered to the generic market for transport, freight, lorry, unspecified. Which means, that 50% of people using this transport do not know or do not care about the size of the vehicle and the EURO class.
References:
CETESB (2019). Companhia Ambiental do Estado de São Paulo (2019). Emissões Veiculares no Estado de São Paulo. Governo do Estado de São Paulo. Available at: cetesb.sp.gov.br/veicular/relatoriose-publicacoes/. [Accessed on 15/06/2020]
EPL (2018). Plano Nacional de Logística. PNL - 2025. Relatório Executivo. Available at: epl.gov.br/transporte-inter-regional-de-carga-no-brasil-panorama-2015 [Accessed on 24/05/2021]
